definition: not knowing what to do next/at a loose end
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
way/route/road
(of an expanse of water) vast/distant and indistinct/tiny or insignificant
vast, with no clear boundary/fig. hazy/indistinct/unclear/confused

sentences.english: He was sad, and his thought about future was very somber .
sentences.chinese: 他很不快樂，對未來感到前途渺茫。

sentences.english: Nokia's path is certain pain followed by an uncertain future.
sentences.chinese: 諾基亞的前進道路上必然荊棘叢生，前途渺茫。

sentences.english: But beyond that its future is bleak.
sentences.chinese: 但是大選之後，歐寶的前途渺茫。

sentences.english: At 25 he was an unemployed musician with no prospects.
sentences.chinese: 25歲的他是個沒有工作，前途渺茫的樂師。

definition: hanging in the balance/the future is hard to forecast/¿Qué serà?/who knows what the future holds?
discouraged/downhearted
prospects/future outlook/journey
every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
without hope/hopeless/without prospects
vast and indistinct/perplexed/bewildered/at a loss
not having any special skill/without any qualifications
a hero with no chance of using his might/to have no opportunity to display one's talents
pinyin: ying1 xiong2 wu2 yong4 wu3 zhi1 di4

definition: discouraged/downhearted
not foreseen/unpredictable/not on the cards
uncertain/remote/distant and indistinct/vague
to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
to have achieved nothing/to be a total failure/to get nowhere
to await job assignment (term used only in mainland China)
to idle/to waste time
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
